author: pdobacz
content: I initially üëç-ed it, but then when I say "instruction swap thirteen", which one do I really mean üò≠ ?

author: frangio_
content:
yeah this is an issue

i also have doubts about whether it's fine to disassemble code in a way that you can't tell what exact instruction was in the original bytecode. but i'm not sure if this is an issue. perhaps if relative jumps are expressed as numbers rather than labels

author: .fjl
content: I would say go with the 'verbatim' option

author: .fjl
content: For EXCHANGE, an assembler will very likely want to have special support for encoding the two immediate operands, even though it's technically just one immediate.

author: .fjl
content:
In geas, I would probably use the syntax

```
exchange 3, 4
```
